docs.text: i had lost all faith in pg-13 movies that are intended for teenagers and adults .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the last dozen or so that i have seen have all felt incomplete , as if the most crucial scene was deleted in order to obtain a more lucrative rating .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: however , after seeing the creative frequency last week and now the exciting u-571 , my bias is beginning to go away .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: both films are as innocuous for younger viewers as they are intellectual for older viewers .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: even better , i didn't think either one of these films would be any good from first instincts .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: everyone loves surprises .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: u-571 looked like another action film using an actual war as an excuse to shoot torpedoes and bullets .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this may be true , but the action is so extraordinary that it is clear director/co-writer jonathan mostow completed his ultimate goal ; to blow the audience's socks off .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: set during the early stages of world war 2 when the united states struggled to break the codes of the technologically advanced german u-boats , u-571 follows a small crew of american men who swipe the typewriter necessary to solve the enigma from an enemy ship .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: there's only one problem : the american ship they came from and hoped to return to has been shot down stranding the men on a german submarine known as ( you guessed it ) u-571 .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: it is now up to the mostly young and inexperienced sailors , led by an interim captain named tyler ( matthew mcconaughey ) , to return the typewriter to america without getting sunk by far superior german ships .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the film starts off very slowly with a somewhat weak opening action sequence and another uneventful half an hour to introduce several of the sailors ( most of whom die when the mission goes awry or just inexplicably disappear ) .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: once the crew gets on the u-boat , the movie shifts to another level and never leaves this high energy level until the ending credits roll down .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: as soon as the action starts , it does not stop and luckily , because it is so exciting , i didn't want it to stop .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: this is not a movie for those wanting to avoid loud noises , from the wonderful , heart-pounding score to the constant yelling of panicking men , make sure you see this at a theater with surround-sound ? otherwise , do not see it all .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: the best parts of u-571 are when tyler is forced to make impromptu decisions on how to escape seemingly impossible situations .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: throughout the movie , several morals or characters are introduced to make tyler's job as stressful as possible .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: germans gun down their own men , tyler's mentor captain dahlgren warns him that a captain has to be prepared to sacrifice even the most beloved soldiers for a victory , another sailor ( erik palladino ) threatens mutiny .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: all of these examples , and several others , increase the chaotic atmosphere and the importance of tyler's every move .
docs.label: positive

docs.text: they also make u-571 one of the most exhilarating movies i have seen in a while .
docs.label: positive
